comments.creator: anygregor@gmail.com
comments.author: anygregor@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Looks like we have some leaks during the dromaeo JavaScript performance suite.
We start with a marking time of around 10 ms for each GC. After a while the marking time increases to 60ms even for compartment GCs.
comments.text:
Created attachment 536820
GCTimer output

Looks like we have some leaks during the dromaeo JavaScript performance suite.
We start with a marking time of around 10 ms for each GC. After a while the marking time increases to 60ms even for compartment GCs.

comments.creator: bill.mccloskey@gmail.com
comments.author: bill.mccloskey@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Neat find. Is it possible that they're just stashing away benchmark results in some sort of large, inefficient data structure? We should try to get a break down of the mark time and see how much XPConnect is contributing, since I assume that's the sort of leak you're thinking of?
comments.text: Neat find. Is it possible that they're just stashing away benchmark results in some sort of large, inefficient data structure? We should try to get a break down of the mark time and see how much XPConnect is contributing, since I assume that's the sort of leak you're thinking of?

comments.raw_text: There could be all sorts of stashing involved, yes.  Worth looking at the actual code too, perhaps.
comments.text: There could be all sorts of stashing involved, yes.  Worth looking at the actual code too, perhaps.

comments.creator: n.nethercote@gmail.com
comments.text: Gregor, would you have time to look into this?
comments.raw_text: Gregor, would you have time to look into this?
Downgrading this bug -- I don't think we're going to take any concrete action here unless we have a reason to think that Dromaeo itself is not to blame here.
